pages.md:
- To disable touch controls and hide the touch screen mode indicator, select OFF for **BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > TOUCH SCREEN SETTING**.
- Touch control settings can be adjusted using **AF/MF SETTING > TOUCH SCREEN MODE**. For information on the touch controls available during movie recording, see â€œMovie Recording (ðŸŽ¥ TOUCH SCREEN MODE; ðŸ“– 210)â€.

# MOVIE OPTIMIZED CONTROL ðŸŽ¥ðŸ”‡

Selecting ON for **MOVIE SETTING > MOVIE OPTIMIZED CONTROL ðŸŽ¥ðŸ”‡** or tapping the movie-optimized mode button in the shooting display optimizes the command dials and touch controls for movie recording. This can be used to prevent camera sounds being recorded with movie footage.

- **SHUTTER SPEED**
- **APERTURE**
- **EXPOSURE COMPENSATION**
- **ISO**
- **INTERNAL MIC LEVEL ADJUSTMENT/EXTERNAL MIC LEVEL ADJUSTMENT**
- **WIND FILTER**
- **HEADPHONES VOLUME**
- **FILM SIMULATION**
- **WHITE BALANCE**
- **IS MODE**
- **IS MODE BOOST**

!Movie-optimized mode button

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - Enabling movie-optimized controls disables the aperture ring and the shutter-speed, sensitivity, and exposure compensation dials.
> - When movie-optimized control is enabled, the movie-optimized mode button can be used to change shooting settings or disable movie-optimized control.
